metadata.description: Real South African interview questions from verified sources (Careers24, News24)

language_markers.Ubuntu: I am because we are - African philosophy

cultural_context.interview_structure: Competency-focused, less hierarchical than other African markets, panel or one-on-one formats

common_questions.question: Tell me more about yourself?
common_questions.tip: Tell them about yourself in a WORK context - interviewers don't want life stories

common_questions.question: Why should we hire you?
common_questions.purpose: See how much research you have done into the company

common_questions.question: What are your strongest personal qualities?
What are your weakest personal qualities?

questions_to_prepare: Why did you leave your last job?
Questions hiring managers are NOT allowed to ask

bee_transformation_questions.question: What is your understanding of BEE?
bee_transformation_questions.context: Tests knowledge of Black Economic Empowerment

bee_transformation_questions.question: How do you contribute to transformation?
bee_transformation_questions.context: Tests active participation in diversity initiatives

bee_transformation_questions.question: How do you handle working with people from different backgrounds?
bee_transformation_questions.context: Critical in SA context - diversity consciousness

bee_transformation_questions.question: What does Ubuntu mean to you in a workplace context?

competency_based_approach.definition: Structured interview that uses behavioural questions to help the interviewer identify a candidate's competencies
competency_based_approach.method: Behavioural questions based on five broad dimensions
competency_based_approach.purpose: Uncover the behavioural facets of a candidate

Standard_Bank.type: One of Africa's largest banking groups
